May 3, 13:55 PDT Investigating - Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with the Twilio Console when users are attempting to purchase a number. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Meet. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are unable to access Google Meet, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-17 19:04 and ended at 2023-04-25 14:38 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Incident Report

Summary

Starting on 17 April 2023 at 12:04, some Google Meet Hardware devices failed to launch the Meet app and the devices displayed a “Waiting for application window” message for a duration of 7 days, 19 hours and 34 minutes. To our Google Meet Hardware customers who were affected we sincerely apologize. This is not the level of quality and reliability we strive to offer you, and we are taking immediate steps to improve the platform’s performance and availability.

Root Cause

The device requires a healthy network state and a fully initialized Meet application in order to launch. When the affected devices started up after a reboot, certain conditions caused a network check to fail. Under these circumstances, the device displayed a “Waiting for application window” message indefinitely. Devices that were automatically upgraded to the next version of ChromeOS were more susceptible to these conditions.

Remediation and Prevention

Google engineers were able to identify a fix and deploy to the beta fleet of production on 21 April 2023 at 07:24 US/Pacific (within 24 hours of reproducing the issue). Google engineers instructed affected customers, who wanted to expedite receiving the fix, to move their devices to the Beta release channel. The incident was mitigated after the fix was released to the stable channel on 25 April 2023 at 07:38 US/Pacific.

We apologize for the length and severity of this incident. We are taking immediate steps to prevent a recurrence and improve reliability in the future, by completing the following actions :

  • Fix the underlying issue in the application launcher to prevent it from getting in a stuck state Improve logging, monitoring, and alerting for the fleet so that issues can be identified quickly
  • Google is committed to quickly and continually improving our technology and operations to prevent service disruptions. We appreciate your patience and apologize again for the impact to your organization. We thank you for your business.

Detailed Description of Impact

Beginning from 17 April 2023 at 12:04 US/Pacific, multiple customers of Google Meet Hardware devices, with Operating System (OS) versions greater than 14816.84.1 but lower than 14816.84.35, began to encounter issues in device startup following the upgrade.

At its peak, Google engineers were able to identify that around ~5000 devices had stopped, which caused the admins to receive an “offline device” alert for each of those devices.

These devices were frozen with “Waiting for application window” and would eventually go to sleep if left idle. The devices needed to be rebooted manually (sometimes with mitigation steps involving disconnecting the ethernet cable) or waiting for the device to reboot during a maintenance window.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: Incident: Enterprise Grid customers experiencing errors when starting a workflow
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On May 1, 2023, from 3:53 PM PDT to 6:45 PM PDT, some Enterprise Grid customers may have experienced issues launching workflows in Slack.
A recent change to workflows inadvertently introduced an issue that resulted in the error codes REBBE72D5DA6 and REBA7F7D9186 when launching workflows. We rolled back the change, which resolved the issue for all affected customers.

entry.title: Incident: Slack.com links are broken for some users on Enterprise Grid
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From April 19, 2023 at 3:05 PM PST until April 28, 2023 at 7:51 PM PST, customers signed in with an Enterprise Grid workspace may have experienced unexpected redirect behaviour when navigating https://slack.com/ links.
We appreciate your patience as we investigated the issue. Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the routing behaviour; however, please reach out to feedback@slack.com if you continue to experience any trouble.

entry.title: TS-2023-005
entry.summary: Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server in device reauthentication logic caused previously authenticated and tagged devices to lose their ACL tags upon reauthentication. What happened? The logic that handles the reauthentication to a new identity on an already-authenticated device with tags had a bug: instead of updating the device’s logged-in identity to the newly authenticated user, the device’s identity became that of the user who originally added it to the tailnet, without any tags. The bug was introduced on 2022-10-26, and discovered and remediated on 2023-04-21. The bug was discovered when troubleshooting a user-reported issue. Who is affected? 189 tailnets triggered this bug in the course of normal use of Tailscale, either directly by explicitly re-authenticating a device, or indirectly by using fast user switching to switch between multiple tailnets. We have notified affected organizations where we have security contacts. What is the impact? Devices that encountered the bug had their tags removed, which reverted the device’s identity to that of the user who originally authenticated the device, or the owner of the auth key that was originally used to authenticate the device. In either case, this is the user listed as “Creator” in the Machines tab of the admin panel. Depending on access rules in the tailnet policy file, this could change the device’s network permissions. We have analyzed the audit logs for affected tailnets, and found no evidence of deliberate exploitation. In most instances, device owners noticed the incorrect outcome of reauthentication, and corrected the device’s state themselves. What do I need to do? If you were not contacted by Tailscale, no action is required. If you were contacted by Tailscale, reapply the desired tags to affected devices in the admin console, or by reauthenticating the devices. Tailscale has deployed a fix to the coordination server as of 2023-04-21, and notified affected organizations.

entry.title: Incident: Users are not able to send, shuffle or cancel gifs with Giphy.
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On April 24, 2023 from 11:25 AM PDT to 2:00 PM PDT, some users experienced issues with sending, shuffling and cancelling gifs using the Giphy app. We traced the issue to a recent update that impacted how we handle buttons in the /giphy slash command.
We rolled back this change, resolving the issue for all impacted users.

entry.title: Incident with Actions
entry.summary: Apr 24, 13:27 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Apr 24, 12:57 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

entry.title: Incident: A small percentage of users may be experiencing slowness in Slack.
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On April 20th, 2023 from 6:00 AM PDT until 7:45 AM PDT, a small number of users experienced latency issues when using Slack. Users reported a delay in loading threads, channels, direct messages, marking messages as read, and executing workflows.
The issue resulted from an increased database load on one of our data center regions. We made a change in order manage the larger load and return to normal response times.
Our team is continuing to look into what causes some queries to run slower than others to prevent degraded performance in the future.
Thank you for your patience while we worked through this. We apologize for any disruption to your work.

entry.title: New damage deposit payment management setting
entry.summary:
New!
We are happy to announce that new damage deposit payment settings are now available in your Smily account. Those new settings will allow you to better manage your damage deposit payments, as well as provide a better experience to your guests. Why the changes? Up until now, when going to your general damage deposit payment management settings (in Settings > Payments > Default preferences), the only option available regarding the collection of your damage deposit was the collection time: either with bookings payment or on arrival. Both options led to the damage deposit being due via the Smily payment link, and to wrong information being displayed on the Smily payment page and the Smily booking contract in case you were managing your damage deposit via a partner app such as Swikly. Wh…

author.name: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead

entry.title: Incident: Channels are missing for Android users
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On April 16rd, 2023 from 12:11 PM PDT until 14:39 PM PDT, certain Android users on the Free plan reported issues with loading channels in the Android app.
Upon investigation, this was attributed to the implementation of a data optimization feature, intended to improve app performance. We have rolled back this feature temporarily, which has corrected the observed issue. A full investigation and remedy will take place prior to reimplementation.
Thank you for your patience while we worked through this. We apologize for any disruption to your work.

entry.title: Incident: Direct messages view failing to load
entry.summary: This issue has now been resolved, please reload Slack to restore functionality to the direct messages view. Thank you for your patience while we worked on this.

entry.title: Incident: Images slow to upload
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On April 10, 2023 at 7:30 PM PDT, some customers began experiencing delays when uploading files. We traced the issue back to a recent update made to how some file uploads are handled. Reverting this change fixed the issue, and customers were no longer experiencing it as of April 11, 2023 at 7:33 AM PDT.
Thank you so much for your patience as our team actively worked on this.

entry.title: Issue impacting users in Korea

We're still actively monitoring the issue. Apr 6, 23:01 PDT Investigating - We are experiencing performance issues that may impact users in Korea. Users may experience significant delays when interacting with static content, like images and videos. Engineering is investigating the root cause of the degradation.

entry.title: Twitter app is down
entry.summary: Apr 7, 17:19 CEST Resolved - While we still await details from Twitter the only way how to create a connection at this moment is to have every user to create their own Twitter app at developer.twitter.com and use the apps API Key and API Key Secret to create a new connection in Make. We updated our documentation with details about how to obtain API Key and API Key Secret - https://www.make.com/en/help/apps/marketing/twitter#obtaining-api-key-and-api-key-secret-values-for-your-twitter-account Apr 3, 23:56 CEST Update - Twitter has suspended our app. We are continuing to investigate. Apr 3, 21:29 CEST Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

entry.title: Reminder - Important information regarding your website domain!
entry.summary:
Action required
Following our recent messages concerning the changes needed for your website domains, we would like to inform you that we have extended the support for the previous configuration until April 10 2023. If you have not made the needeed changes yet, please consult our manual article here. If you need assistance doing the changes, please contact our support team and we will be happy to assist you with the modifications. Please make sure to have access to your registrar (Gandi, OVH, Godaddy…) so we can assist you in performing this change. Thanks,

author.name: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team

entry.title: 403 and 404 Errors Across Multiple Endpoints

The incident was active between April 4th 20:00 PDT and April 5th 00:00 PDT. You can retry any failed requests at this point, and if you keep experiencing issues, please contact the API integration team for additional help. We apologize for the inconvenience caused. Apr 5, 00:51 PDT Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Apr 4, 23:15 PDT Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Apr 4, 21:57 PDT Investigating - We are currently investigating an issue related to 403 and 404 Errors across multiple endpoints. We'll post updates as we have more information.

entry.title: XML Migration Enforcement
entry.summary: Apr 5, 01:46 PDT Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Jul 5, 13:00 PDT In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Jun 30, 10:55 PDT Scheduled - As announced on July 5, 2021 we are deprecating our XML API connection. XML listings can no longer be activated: this means that new XML listings will remain unlisted even if you set true . The same is valid for existing listing that are deactivated (i.e. you will not be able to reactivate a XML listing if it gets unlisted). More information about this enforcement here: https://developer.airbnb.com/docs/enforcement
